events.originalText: Russian forces capture the city of Kherson during the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
events.subtitle: Russia
events.headline: Russian forces capture city of Kherson during invasion of Ukraine

events.originalText: A naming ceremony for the chemical elements moscovium, tennessine, and oganesson took place at the Russian Academy of Sciences in Moscow.
events.subtitle: Chemical element
events.headline: Naming ceremony for moscovium, tennessine, and oganesson held at Russian Academy of Sciences

events.originalText: Researchers at Fermilab in Illinois announced the discovery of the top quark, the most massive of all observed elementary particles.
events.subtitle: Fermilab
events.headline: Researchers at Fermilab in Illinois discover top quark

events.originalText: As a cosmonaut on Soyuz 28, Czechoslovak military pilot Vladimír Remek (pictured) became the first person from outside the Soviet Union or the United States to go into space.
events.subtitle: Astronaut
events.headline: Czechoslovak military pilot Vladimír Remek becomes first person from outside Soviet Union or U.S. to go into space

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The American and South Vietnamese air forces began Operation Rolling Thunder, a sustained bombing campaign against North Vietnam that eventually became the most intense air–ground battle waged during the Cold War period.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: American and South Vietnamese air forces begin Operation Rolling Thunder in Vietnam War

events.originalText: Playing for the Philadelphia Warriors, American basketball player Wilt Chamberlain scored 100 points in a game against the New York Knicks, which remains an NBA record.
events.subtitle: Golden State Warriors
events.headline: Wilt Chamberlain scores 100 points in game against New York Knicks

events.originalText: Led by General Ne Win, the Burmese military seized power in a coup d'état.
events.subtitle: Ne Win
events.headline: General Ne Win leads Burmese military coup d'état

events.originalText: The B-50 Superfortress Lucky Lady II landed in Fort Worth, Texas, to complete the first non-stop circumnavigation of the world by airplane.
events.subtitle: Boeing B-50 Superfortress
events.headline: B-50 Superfortress Lucky Lady II completes first non-stop circumnavigation of the world

events.originalText: World War II: Australian and U.S. air forces attacked and destroyed a large Japanese naval convoy in the Bismarck Sea, north of Papua New Guinea.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Australian and U.S. air forces destroy Japanese naval convoy in Bismarck Sea during World War II

events.originalText: The Steel Workers Organizing Committee, the precursor of the United Steel Workers of America, had a major success when it signed a collective-bargaining agreement with U.S. Steel.
events.subtitle: Steel Workers Organizing Committee
events.headline: Steel Workers Organizing Committee signs collective-bargaining agreement with U.S. Steel

events.originalText: Communist, revolutionary-socialist, and syndicalist delegates met in Moscow to establish the Communist International.
events.subtitle: Communism
events.headline: Communist International established in Moscow

events.originalText: U.S. Steel, the first billion-dollar corporation and once the world's largest producer of steel, was founded by financier J. P. Morgan.
events.subtitle: U.S. Steel
events.headline: U.S. Steel founded by financier J. P. Morgan

events.originalText: The Electoral Commission awarded twenty disputed electoral votes to Rutherford B. Hayes, thus assuring his victory in the 1876 U.S. presidential election.
events.subtitle: Electoral Commission (United States)
events.headline: Electoral Commission awards disputed electoral votes to Rutherford B. Hayes in 1876 U.S. presidential election

events.originalText: New Zealand Wars: Carl Sylvius Völkner, a Protestant missionary, was killed by Hauhau militants in Ōpōtiki for working as an agent for New Zealand governor-general George Grey.
events.subtitle: New Zealand Wars
events.headline: Protestant missionary Carl Sylvius Völkner killed by Hauhau militants in New Zealand

events.originalText: The Great Slave Auction, the largest single sale of slaves in U.S. history, with more than 400 people sold, began in Georgia.
events.subtitle: Great Slave Auction
events.headline: Great Slave Auction begins in Georgia, largest single sale of slaves in U.S. history

events.originalText: Texas Revolution: At a convention of delegates in Washington-on-the-Brazos, the Mexican state of Texas adopted a declaration of independence, establishing the Republic of Texas.
events.subtitle: Texas Revolution
events.headline: Texas adopts declaration of independence, establishing Republic of Texas

events.originalText: French inventor Claude Chappe and his brothers first demonstrated the semaphore telegraph, a system to convey information by means of visual signals, using towers with pivoting crossarms.
events.subtitle: Claude Chappe
events.headline: Claude Chappe demonstrates semaphore telegraph system

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Patriot militiamen from Georgia and South Carolina attempted to resist the British action to seize and remove supply ships anchored at Savannah, Georgia.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Patriot militiamen attempt to resist British action in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: The College of Arms, one of the few remaining official heraldic authorities in Europe, was incorporated by royal charter in the City of London.
events.subtitle: College of Arms
events.headline: College of Arms incorporated in City of London

events.originalText: The League of Lezhë, an alliance of regional chieftains, was established in Venetian Albania with Skanderbeg as their commander.
events.subtitle: League of Lezhë
events.headline: League of Lezhë established in Venetian Albania with Skanderbeg as commander
